CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 27, 1945, pg. 19 reads: "Poro Graduates - The fall graduation exercises of the Poro Beauty School, 7153 Monticello Street, were held in Grace Memorial Presbyterian Church, Sunday, Sept. 30. There were thirty-one members of the graduating class.  The second annual banquet was held Monday, Oct. 1, at the Kay Boys' Club, where Mrs. Annie M. Malone of Chicago, president and founder of the Beauty School and Mrs. Josie Clark of Carbondale, Ill., were honored guests.  Pictured at the banquet are, seated, left to right: Fannie Wilson, Mary D. Bolen, Frankye Bass, Bessie Hunt, Annie Malone, Josie Clark, Ida Adams, Cory Adams, Vera Taliaferro and Elizabeth Apple.  Standing are Elsie Wheeler, Lillie Belle Ratliff, Pearl Witcher, Vera Mae Haney, Ann Hanson, Sarah Batton, Delores Taylor, Pearl Jackson and Edith Daniels. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Poro Beauty School graduates, seated from left: Fannie Wilson, Mary D. Bolen, Frankye Bass, Bessie Hunt, Annie Malone, Josie Clark, Ida Adams, Cory Adams, Vera Taliaferro, and Elizabeth Apple; standing: Elsie Wheeler, Lillie Belle Ratliff, Pearl Witcher, Vera Mae Haney, Ann Hanson, Sarah Batton, Delores Taylor, Pearl Jackson, and Edith Daniels, posed at banquet table in Kay Boys' Club
